choices.A: to withdraw routing information from the network
choices.B: to find alternate loop-free paths that have been discarded due to split horizons
choices.C: to test known alternate paths and determine if they are loop-free
choices.D: to test for neighbor state when the network topology is in flux

comments.content: Actually B is correct (neighbor state is not relevant)

questions.question_text: Why is H-VPLS considered more scalable than flat VPLS?

discussion.content: Single answer question. B is correct.

choices.D: It eliminates signaling overhead between the N-PE and U-PE.
choices.B: It minimizes signaling overhead by only requiring a full pseudowire mesh among N-PEs.
choices.C: It eliminates signaling overhead on core devices.
choices.A: It minimizes signaling overhead by building two separate layers pseudowire meshes.
